metadata.title: CVE-2024-36600 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow Vulnerability in libcdio v2.1.0 allows an attacker toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted ISO 9660 image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcdio-cdda1 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3
libcdio-paranoia1 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3
libcdio-utils - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3
libcdio13 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3
libiso9660-8 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3
libudf0 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libcdio package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm3').
